titleproper.value: "Charcoals of New and Old New York"<lb/>Drafts and Limited Edition Published Version<lb/>1912, undated<lb/> <num>MS 3149</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2020-01-08T21:27:47</date>

unittitle.value: "Charcoals of new and old New York" drafts and limited edition published version

abstract.value:
The collection includes three documents: 1) a published version of F. Hopkinson Smith's "Charcoals of New and Old New York," signed by Smith and printed on Van Gelder handmade paper, number 59(?) of 125; 2) an annotated and edited typescript draft of Charcoals; and 3) a draft manuscript with both typed and autograph (holographic) pages. The draft has multiple versions of at least some of the chapters. Chapters include: I. Wall Street; II. The Skyscraper; III. The Brooklyn Bridge; IV. The City Hall; V. Castle Garden; VI. Behind Shinbone Alley; VII. Elizabeth Street; VIII. Clinton Court; IX. No. 5 West Twenty-eighth Street; X. The Little Church Around the Corner; XI. The Grand Canon of the Yellow; XII. The Stock Exchange; XIII. The Upheaval [construction site]; XIV. The Subway--Bridge Station; XV. Manhattan; XVI. Madison Square; XVII Gansevoort Market; XVIII. Edgar Allan Poe's House at Fordham; XIX. Jumel Mansion; XX. The Bronx; XXI. The Willows.<lb/> <lb/>

To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: <extref actuate="onRequest" href="http://bobcat.library.nyu.edu/primo-explore/fulldisplay?docid=nyu_aleph007446400&context=L&vid=NYHS&search_scope=nyhs&tab=nyhs&lang=en_US">"Charcoals of new and old New York" drafts and limited edition published version</extref>
